column2: What are the main differences between prospect management and prospect research work?
column3: Copilot: Prospect research handles donor communications, while prospect management oversees event planning.
column4: Prospect research is often reactive and service-based, focusing on capacity, professional background, and philanthropic interests, while prospect management is more proactive, guiding strategy and portfolio development.

column2: What obstacles exist in balancing a portfolio of prospects?
column3: No process for handing off prospects
column5: Low number of prospects in priority area

column2: What is the right size for an average portfolio?
When rating prospective donors, what does RFM stand for?
In project management, what is scope creep?
column3: When project requirements go beyond the original objective
column4: When project deadlines are met too soon
